speaker: her
text: You're not hurt, I hope, miss,

speaker: his
text: I'm awful frightened,

speaker: Unknown
text: whoever would have thought that Poncho would have been so scared by a lot of cows?

speaker: her
text: Thank God you kept your seat,

speaker: his
text: I guess you are the daughter of John Ferrier,

speaker: Unknown
text: I saw you ride down from his house. When you see him, ask him if he remembers the Jefferson Hopes of St. Louis. If he's the same Ferrier, my father and he were pretty thick.

speaker: Unknown
text: Hadn't you better come and ask yourself?

speaker: his
text: I'll do so,

speaker: Unknown
text: we've been in the mountains for two months, and are not over and above in visiting condition. He must take us as he finds us.

speaker: Unknown
text: He has a good deal to thank you for, and so have I,

speaker: her
text: he's awful fond of me. If those cows had jumped on me he'd have never got over it.

speaker: her
text: Neither would I,

speaker: her
text: You! Well, I don't see that it would make much matter to you, anyhow. You ain't even a friend of ours.

speaker: her
text: There, I didn't mean that,

speaker: Unknown
text: of course, you are a friend now. You must come and see us. Now I must push along, or father won't trust me with his business any more. Good-bye!

speaker: his
text: Good-bye,

speaker: Unknown
text: I am off, Lucy,

speaker: her
text: I won't ask you to come with me now, but will you be ready to come when I am here again?

speaker: her
text: And when will that be?

speaker: Unknown
text: A couple of months at the outside. I will come and claim you then, my darling. There's no one who can stand between us.

speaker: Unknown
text: And how about father?

speaker: Unknown
text: He has given his consent, provided we get these mines working all right. I have no fear on that head.

speaker: his
text: Oh, well; of course, if you and father have arranged it all, there's no more to be said,

speaker: his
text: Thank God!

speaker: his
text: It is settled, then. The longer I stay, the harder it will be to go. They are waiting for me at the ca√±on. Good-bye, my own darling--good-bye. In two months you shall see me.
